TASK-30: Feature Flag Plumbing

Overview

Implement a feature flag system to enable/disable features dynamically without code deployments, supporting gradual rollouts, A/B testing, and emergency kill switches.

Feature Flags to Implement

1. enable_confidential_projects

Purpose: Control visibility of confidential/sensitive projects
Default: false
Scope: Global or per-user
Use Cases: - Hide sensitive projects from certain users - Gradual rollout of confidential project features - Emergency disable if security issue found

2. enable_gap_matcher

Purpose: Enable/disable the skills gap matching feature
Default: true
Scope: Global
Use Cases: - Disable if matching algorithm has issues - A/B test different matching algorithms - Performance optimization during high load

3. enable_learning_profile

Purpose: Enable/disable learning profile and catalog features
Default: true
Scope: Global or per-user
Use Cases: - Gradual rollout to users - Disable if learning catalog has issues - Feature gating for premium users

Architecture

Storage Options

Option 1: Database Table (Recommended)

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS feature_flags (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    flag_key TEXT UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    flag_value BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT false,
    description TEXT,
    scope TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'global', -- 'global', 'user', 'role'
    enabled_for_users UUID[] DEFAULT '{}',
    enabled_for_roles TEXT[] DEFAULT '{}',
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX idx_feature_flags_key ON feature_flags(flag_key);
CREATE INDEX idx_feature_flags_scope ON feature_flags(scope);

-- Enable RLS
ALTER TABLE feature_flags ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Policy: Everyone can read flags
CREATE POLICY feature_flags_read_all ON feature_flags
    FOR SELECT
    USING (true);

-- Policy: Only admins can modify flags
CREATE POLICY feature_flags_write_admin ON feature_flags
    FOR ALL
    USING (
        EXISTS (
            SELECT 1 FROM users
            WHERE users.id = auth.uid()
            AND users.access_role IN ('leader', 'manager')
        )
    );

-- Seed initial flags
INSERT INTO feature_flags (flag_key, flag_value, description, scope) VALUES
    ('enable_confidential_projects', false, 'Show/hide confidential projects', 'global'),
    ('enable_gap_matcher', true, 'Enable skills gap matching feature', 'global'),
    ('enable_learning_profile', true, 'Enable learning profile and catalog', 'global')
ON CONFLICT (flag_key) DO NOTHING;

Option 2: Environment Variables (Simple)

# .env
FEATURE_ENABLE_CONFIDENTIAL_PROJECTS=false
FEATURE_ENABLE_GAP_MATCHER=true
FEATURE_ENABLE_LEARNING_PROFILE=true

Option 3: Configuration File

{
  "features": {
    "enable_confidential_projects": {
      "enabled": false,
      "description": "Show/hide confidential projects",
      "scope": "global"
    },
    "enable_gap_matcher": {
      "enabled": true,
      "description": "Enable skills gap matching feature",
      "scope": "global"
    },
    "enable_learning_profile": {
      "enabled": true,
      "description": "Enable learning profile and catalog",
      "scope": "global"
    }
  }
}

Feature Flag Service (Backend)

// Feature flag cache (refresh every 60 seconds)
let featureFlagCache = new Map();
let lastFlagRefresh = 0;
const FLAG_CACHE_TTL = 60000; // 60 seconds

/**
 * Load feature flags from database
 */
async function loadFeatureFlags() {
    try {
        const { data, error } = await supabase
            .from('feature_flags')
            .select('*');
        
        if (error) throw error;
        
        const flags = new Map();
        (data || []).forEach(flag => {
            flags.set(flag.flag_key, {
                value: flag.flag_value,
                scope: flag.scope,
                enabledForUsers: flag.enabled_for_users || [],
                enabledForRoles: flag.enabled_for_roles || []
            });
        });
        
        featureFlagCache = flags;
        lastFlagRefresh = Date.now();
        
        console.log(`[FLAGS] Loaded ${flags.size} feature flags`);
    } catch (e) {
        console.error('[FLAGS] Error loading feature flags:', e.message);
    }
}

/**
 * Check if a feature flag is enabled
 * @param {string} flagKey - Feature flag key
 * @param {Object} context - User context (optional)
 * @param {string} context.userId - User ID
 * @param {string} context.userRole - User role
 * @returns {boolean} - Whether the flag is enabled
 */
async function isFeatureEnabled(flagKey, context = {}) {
    // Refresh cache if stale
    if (Date.now() - lastFlagRefresh > FLAG_CACHE_TTL) {
        await loadFeatureFlags();
    }
    
    const flag = featureFlagCache.get(flagKey);
    
    // Flag doesn't exist - default to false
    if (!flag) {
        console.warn(`[FLAGS] Unknown flag: ${flagKey}`);
        return false;
    }
    
    // Global scope - return flag value
    if (flag.scope === 'global') {
        return flag.value;
    }
    
    // User scope - check if user is in enabled list
    if (flag.scope === 'user' && context.userId) {
        return flag.enabledForUsers.includes(context.userId);
    }
    
    // Role scope - check if user role is in enabled list
    if (flag.scope === 'role' && context.userRole) {
        return flag.enabledForRoles.includes(context.userRole);
    }
    
    // Default to flag value
    return flag.value;
}

/**
 * Middleware to check feature flag
 */
function requireFeature(flagKey) {
    return async (req, res, next) => {
        const enabled = await isFeatureEnabled(flagKey, {
            userId: req.__user?.id,
            userRole: req.__user?.access_role
        });
        
        if (!enabled) {
            return res.status(403).json({ 
                error: `Feature '${flagKey}' is not enabled`,
                featureDisabled: true
            });
        }
        
        next();
    };
}

// Initialize flags on startup
loadFeatureFlags();

// Refresh flags periodically
setInterval(loadFeatureFlags, FLAG_CACHE_TTL);

Feature Flag API Endpoints

/* ========================================================================
 * Feature Flags Management
 * ===================================================================== */

// Get all feature flags
app.get("/api/feature-flags", requireProxyIdentity, async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const me = await getOrCreateUserByEmail(req.__email);
        
        const { data, error } = await supabase
            .from('feature_flags')
            .select('flag_key, flag_value, description, scope');
        
        if (error) throw error;
        
        // Evaluate flags for current user
        const evaluatedFlags = {};
        for (const flag of data || []) {
            evaluatedFlags[flag.flag_key] = await isFeatureEnabled(flag.flag_key, {
                userId: me.id,
                userRole: me.access_role
            });
        }
        
        res.json({ 
            flags: evaluatedFlags,
            metadata: data 
        });
    } catch (e) {
        res.status(500).json({ error: e.message });
    }
});

// Update feature flag (admin only)
app.put("/api/feature-flags/:key", requireProxyIdentity, async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const me = await getOrCreateUserByEmail(req.__email);
        if (!isAdminRole(me.access_role)) {
            return res.status(403).json({ error: "Admins only" });
        }
        
        const { key } = req.params;
        const { value, enabledForUsers, enabledForRoles } = req.body;
        
        const updates = {
            updated_at: new Date().toISOString()
        };
        
        if (typeof value === 'boolean') {
            updates.flag_value = value;
        }
        if (Array.isArray(enabledForUsers)) {
            updates.enabled_for_users = enabledForUsers;
        }
        if (Array.isArray(enabledForRoles)) {
            updates.enabled_for_roles = enabledForRoles;
        }
        
        const { data, error } = await supabase
            .from('feature_flags')
            .update(updates)
            .eq('flag_key', key)
            .select()
            .single();
        
        if (error) throw error;
        
        // Refresh cache immediately
        await loadFeatureFlags();
        
        // Audit log
        console.log(`[AUDIT] Feature flag '${key}' updated by ${me.email}`);
        
        res.json({ flag: data });
    } catch (e) {
        res.status(500).json({ error: e.message });
    }
});

Frontend Integration

React Hook

// src/hooks/useFeatureFlag.ts
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { supabase } from '@/integrations/supabase/client';

interface FeatureFlags {
    [key: string]: boolean;
}

export function useFeatureFlags() {
    const [flags, setFlags] = useState<FeatureFlags>({});
    const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
    
    useEffect(() => {
        loadFlags();
    }, []);
    
    async function loadFlags() {
        try {
            const response = await fetch('/api/feature-flags');
            const data = await response.json();
            setFlags(data.flags || {});
        } catch (e) {
            console.error('Failed to load feature flags:', e);
        } finally {
            setLoading(false);
        }
    }
    
    function isEnabled(flagKey: string): boolean {
        return flags[flagKey] === true;
    }
    
    return { flags, isEnabled, loading };
}

// Usage in component
function MyComponent() {
    const { isEnabled, loading } = useFeatureFlags();
    
    if (loading) return <div>Loading...</div>;
    
    return (
        <div>
            {isEnabled('enable_gap_matcher') && (
                <MatchToRoleButton />
            )}
            {isEnabled('enable_learning_profile') && (
                <LearningProfileSection />
            )}
        </div>
    );
}

Feature Flag Component

// src/components/FeatureFlag.tsx
import { useFeatureFlags } from '@/hooks/useFeatureFlag';

interface FeatureFlagProps {
    flag: string;
    children: React.ReactNode;
    fallback?: React.ReactNode;
}

export function FeatureFlag({ flag, children, fallback = null }: FeatureFlagProps) {
    const { isEnabled, loading } = useFeatureFlags();
    
    if (loading) return null;
    
    return isEnabled(flag) ? <>{children}</> : <>{fallback}</>;
}

// Usage
<FeatureFlag flag="enable_gap_matcher">
    <MatchToRoleModal />
</FeatureFlag>

Implementation Examples

1. Confidential Projects

Backend (server.js)

// Filter confidential projects based on flag
app.get("/api/projects", requireProxyIdentity, async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const me = await getOrCreateUserByEmail(req.__email);
        const showConfidential = await isFeatureEnabled('enable_confidential_projects', {
            userId: me.id,
            userRole: me.access_role
        });
        
        let query = supabase.from('projects').select('*');
        
        // Filter out confidential projects if flag is disabled
        if (!showConfidential) {
            query = query.eq('is_confidential', false);
        }
        
        const { data, error } = await query;
        if (error) throw error;
        
        res.json({ projects: data });
    } catch (e) {
        res.status(500).json({ error: e.message });
    }
});

Frontend

function ProjectsList() {
    const { isEnabled } = useFeatureFlags();
    const showConfidential = isEnabled('enable_confidential_projects');
    
    return (
        <div>
            {projects
                .filter(p => showConfidential || !p.is_confidential)
                .map(project => (
                    <ProjectCard key={project.id} project={project} />
                ))}
        </div>
    );
}

2. Gap Matcher

Backend

app.post("/api/match/role", 
    requireProxyIdentity,
    requireFeature('enable_gap_matcher'),
    async (req, res) => {
        // Matching logic
    }
);

Frontend

<FeatureFlag flag="enable_gap_matcher">
    <Button onClick={handleMatchToRole}>
        Match to Role
    </Button>
</FeatureFlag>

3. Learning Profile

Backend

app.get("/api/learning", 
    requireProxyIdentity,
    requireFeature('enable_learning_profile'),
    async (req, res) => {
        // Learning profile logic
    }
);

Frontend

function ProfilePage() {
    const { isEnabled } = useFeatureFlags();
    
    return (
        <div>
            <BasicProfile />
            
            {isEnabled('enable_learning_profile') && (
                <LearningProfileSection />
            )}
        </div>
    );
}

Admin UI for Feature Flags

// src/components/FeatureFlagAdmin.tsx
function FeatureFlagAdmin() {
    const [flags, setFlags] = useState([]);
    
    async function toggleFlag(flagKey: string, newValue: boolean) {
        await fetch(`/api/feature-flags/${flagKey}`, {
            method: 'PUT',
            headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
            body: JSON.stringify({ value: newValue })
        });
        loadFlags();
    }
    
    return (
        <div>
            <h2>Feature Flags</h2>
            {flags.map(flag => (
                <div key={flag.flag_key}>
                    <Toggle
                        id={flag.flag_key}
                        labelText={flag.description}
                        toggled={flag.flag_value}
                        onToggle={(checked) => toggleFlag(flag.flag_key, checked)}
                    />
                </div>
            ))}
        </div>
    );
}

Testing

Unit Tests

describe('Feature Flags', () => {
    it('should return true for enabled global flag', async () => {
        const enabled = await isFeatureEnabled('enable_gap_matcher');
        expect(enabled).toBe(true);
    });
    
    it('should return false for disabled flag', async () => {
        const enabled = await isFeatureEnabled('enable_confidential_projects');
        expect(enabled).toBe(false);
    });
    
    it('should check user-specific flags', async () => {
        const enabled = await isFeatureEnabled('beta_feature', {
            userId: 'user-123'
        });
        expect(enabled).toBe(true);
    });
});

Best Practices

  1. Default to Safe Values
    • New features should default to false
    • Critical features should default to true
  2. Clear Naming
    • Use enable_ prefix for feature toggles
    • Use descriptive names
  3. Documentation
    • Document what each flag controls
    • Document rollout plan
  4. Monitoring
    • Log flag evaluations
    • Track flag usage metrics
    • Alert on flag changes
  5. Cleanup
    • Remove flags after full rollout
    • Archive old flags
    • Keep flag list manageable

Implementation Status

Notes

  • Consider using a dedicated feature flag service (LaunchDarkly, Split.io) for production
  • Implement flag analytics to track usage
  • Set up alerts for flag changes
  • Regular cleanup of unused flags
  • Document flag lifecycle (created â†’ enabled â†’ removed)
